dict.string: A sacred task, young Pan was charged,
A sacred task, young Pan was charged, To keep the sheep of Zeus free from harm.
Heedless he ignored his calling,
Heedless he ignored his calling, playing music to pass his time,
Until a thundering storm came howling,
Until a thundering storm came howling, which flung the unwatched flock far and wide.
Angry Zeus didst punish Pan,
Angry Zeus didst punish Pan, sundering his beloved flute,
"You will return my sheep, as I command,
"You will return my sheep, as I command, by learning to play anew."
Envious was Aeolus,
Envious was Aeolus, god of gust and gale upon the air,
For Pan's talent for music was beyond compare.
Although he could blow a gentle breeze amidst the reeds,
Even at his best he could not contest
Even at his best he could not contest Pan's gift for melodies.
One day he appeared suddenly
One day he appeared suddenly while Pan played music idly,
And with a tempest's might
And with a tempest's might he put to flight all of Zeus's sheep.
Being chastised by the god of sky
Being chastised by the god of sky had left Pan furious,
For Aeolus he tried to blame
For Aeolus he tried to blame for his shameful experience.
Whence in his journey he came
Whence in his journey he came to a village burning and ravaged by war,
He saw a reflection of the rage in his heart caged
He saw a reflection of the rage in his heart caged that he could not ignore.
Soon Pan began to understand
Soon Pan began to understand the purpose of his quest:
He had to reject his former life of neglect
He had to reject his former life of neglect to pass this test.
Danger lies in the dark of night,
Danger lies in the dark of night, and in the shadows creeps,
For hungry eyes cold as ice
For hungry eyes cold as ice are fixed upon helpless sheep.
Villainous Hades who hath sought daily
Villainous Hades who hath sought daily for chaos to be unleashed,
Thinks maybe sheep will be tasty
Thinks maybe sheep will be tasty to his wolves who seek to feast.
From atop a mountain high does he spy
From atop a mountain high does he spy Pan's fateful course,
While his beasts stare from their lairs
While his beasts stare from their lairs without remorse.
However clever Hades considered Pan might be,
However clever Hades considered Pan might be, "He is still a child," he thought with an evil smile,
"and thus easily deceived."
With magic most foul
With magic most foul he conjured monsters to prowl in disguise,
A cunning ruse meant to confuse those hasty or unwise.
For their resemblance to sheep was only skin deep.
If allowed within a flock's safe haven
If allowed within a flock's safe haven Pan would get a fiery surprise.
So at last it came to past
So at last it came to past that Pan's quest was complete,
With a new flute as a reward
With a new flute as a reward so he could once more play sweet melodies.
Zeus was proud that Pan had found
Zeus was proud that Pan had found a new sense of responsibility.
In time making Pan divine
In time making Pan divine was certainly a possibility.
Until then Pan's tale would prevail,
Until then Pan's tale would prevail, a story for everyone to keep,
Forever to be remembered
Forever to be remembered as the master of music and sheep.
